caption: Fantastic service! Perfect blend of attentive and providing enough space to keep my experience intimate. The only thing that eclipsed the service was the meal — oh my, delicious! Ordered three small plates to share with a friend and everything was just spectacular. Deviled eggs, filet o’ fish and blt; I would recommend them all! Also note: the ambiance is chic and minimal. Bright and white with a small pop of color and luxurious use of materiality.

Fun atmosphere, friendly staff, delicious food. Five out of five stars. The staff were absolutely going out of their way to make us feel comfortable and taken care of, even with all of the Covid restrictions in place. Cocktails were also quite good.
Good service but food is incredibly bland and underwhelming
Best Covid service experience Ive had. But also big fluffy parker house rolls.

Stumbled into this restaurant on Thanksgiving Eve for drinks and dinner. It was very slow, quiet, but very peaceful, and their music playlist was just about right. Not too loud, not too quiet. Lots of windows which I loved, pretty decent ambiance, clean bathroom, but super cold, not sure why it was so uncomfortably cold while we had dinner.  I appreciated that they sat us down in an area where there weren’t any people at all because my friend and I had our daughters with us with us. They  tend to get a little loud and rambunctious at times, lol.  Their happy hour drink menu offered bottomless champagne for $22 until 7:30pm which was really cool. The food menu was lengthy, but I have to be honest and say that I struggled with it a bit. There weren’t many entree options in my opinion and there are absolutely zero options for children (this is just an FYI, not kid friendly at all). I ended up ordering the Fried Clams and the Rohan Duck Breast as my entree. The clams were basically fried bread, with no clam, but the duck was delicious, although not very filling (pictured) if I might add. It was nice to try somewhere new and we may be back for drinks one day.

Roof doesn’t look like photos, was disappointed to see it looked just like any other gray apartment complex roof. Different than what they presented on social media (shocker!) Aesthetics aside, staff is slightly slow and hostile, especially when we said we waited for more than 15 minutes for drinks, waiter proceeded to argued with us about it. Hard pass, better places to go for 15 dollar cocktails in DC.
Very nice place and the area, staff really nice and attentive, we didn't try that much food, but deft.I would recommend yo anyone just because of the environment.

Drinks, roof top, and service were good. If I could give 3.5 stars I would. The food left something to be desired, the flavors felt muted and nothing particularly stood out to make me want to come back again.
Nice rooftop dining, excellent food! Mussels diablo, rockfish ceviche & crab cake sandwich (all crabmeat too!) were great choices!

My fiancé brought me here for my birthday and we left before we even completed our meal.  The staff was rude and Inhospitable and the woman who identified herself as an assistant was so hostile and rude that we simply decided to take our money elsewhere. What a terrible experience!  Yuck!.
Good food but highly unfriendly service

I had been looking forward to getting out and trying this place after seeing the new rooftop pictures on Instagram. Much to my surprise, the “rooftop ledge” is just that... a very small ledge with little room for food, and the barstool height makes it super awkward to eat. Also, don’t let name “rooftop ledge” confuse you with the idea that you’ll have a view, because you will not. The food is just okay. Definitely not a culinary experience. If you have to go, I’d recommend going for after dinner drinks and maybe dessert. I enjoyed the key lime pie. It is unlikely that I would return or recommend friends to go.

My wife and I went for dinner and drinks and they were both fantastic. The cocktails were really well crafted and at a good price. The appetizers from the raw bar and entrees were excellent.  On top of that they did a great job with social distancing and protecting their employees and customers. Great food and great service we highly recommend.

I visited this restaurant on a Tuesday night with some friends, and it was wonderful. We sat at the upstairs main bar while Fernando took care of us. We grazed on several different dishes that we divided between the four of us while enjoying several different libations. The bar is unique in that it is stocked with several sherries both sweet and dry. If fortified wines are not your thing, they also have several other cocktails featuring other spirits. The food was all delicious from the Beef Wellington to the Caramelized Onion Tart. The surprise hit of the night was the Kale and Cauliflower with a delicious curry sauce! While we didn’t stay for dessert (hard to compete in that category when you’re located across the street from The Cake Shop), I’m sure the dessert options are also delicious. Don’t skip on this gem when deciding where to grab a bite to eat in the city. Side note, I’m not a big oyster fan, but they also have an oyster bar and great happy hour deals on raw oysters if that is your thing!

YUM! Excellent service at the bar, delicious food, pretty good cocktails. Maybe they weren't hitting my palate that night but the food sure did. Sorghum risotto amazing, with the crispy kale and cauliflower, mega yum especially together, followed with mini beef Wellington. Perfect for 2 to share and join the drool club.

This place is a pretentious gilded show piece for people who are trying easy to hard to impress. Poor service and watered down drinks. I heard the food is good but we did not try anything. I would be surprised if they are still there in 2 years to be honest.

Maybe the best oysters we have ever had. Loved the restaurant design.  However, only three stars because our server was downright HOSTILE to us. Food was good and we spent a ton of money. It was my wife, our 8 mo. old and two friends who were regulars there.  There are so many great restaurants in DC you need to be the total package. Because of our server, we will never return.  To clarify, we were not the only table with a baby.  If you are interested, I recommend sitting at the bar and enjoying the raw seafood. You'll like it! But I'd avoid the restaurant area.

A beautiful restaurant with very good and rather reasonably priced food. Aside from the volume being a bit louder than ideal for a sit down dinner, the real drawback is the service, which was slow and less attentive than one would expect. I would still recommend it, however, and hopefully the service will improve as this very new establishment settles into itself.

As a local resident, there's a shared trait that is consistently apparent in most neighbourhood restaurants: warm hospitality. Restaurants here typically go out of their way to make you feel "at home" - from comfortable decor and lighting to attentive, familial, and friendly service.  All of this is absent from The Imperial, an incredibly sterile environment with stone-faced staff clearly instructed to give the space a pretentious aura. They want you to feel "privileged" to have set foot in their restaurant.  The resulting sense of that approach is that the customer feels more like an impediment than a patron. If you're going to create an uninviting experience, then customers will simply uninvite themselves.
Doesn't seem like it's finished and the space is awkward. I will definitely go back when the raw bar is open.
Everything I ate was of the highest quality, both in taste and appearance. I would highly recommend as a dining experience.
$39 for a bottle of beer. $39 for a bottle of beer...
Nice bar!
Absolutely terrible experience. Slow, inattentive, and rude service. Food was ok, not great. Do not plan to return.

Great food. Beautiful space. Friendly attentive staff. Convenient to several other outstanding food and drink options to make a night of it.  Got the petit seafood tower. So fresh! I ordered the rabbit and paired it with a Gamay, which I really enjoyed. I got a vintage Cognac, which also was excellent.  One serious drawback was the bathroom situation with long waits.  Otherwise, it is a spectacular new edition to the DC dining scene.

For sure a SOLID spot. Just thought things were a little sloppy and not worth the own hype I had put in for this place. Being sat unmarked tables, slow service. Food was nothing to write home about. That being said the tap G & T was delish, would come just for those. Tiki drinks also 10/10.

Seated ourselves (two people) at the raw bar, which was first come first serve this night. No section of the restaurant was particularly busy. Was greeted by our server a few minutes after seating ourselves, and was given a menu and told she'd be right back. About ten minutes later she returns to take our drink order, and we order two cocktails. 25 minutes after this, with no sight of our server, we chose to go somewhere else. I got a hold of our server to let her know, and she seemed to have no recollection of our order, and wanted to give me a check for things we never received.  Just poor service on an average capacity night.

Yeah, I won't be back to the Imperial and I won't be recommending it. I really was expecting a lot because I really like Jack Rose. The food was fine. We were not impressed by any of the dishes that we ordered. We also weren't that impressed by the cocktails which have "low alcoholic value" which is an odd thing to promote (In my opinion). I'm paying $15 for a premixed low alcoholic value drink, why?  The restaurant was freezing the night we were there. We sat in the front room and every time the door opened a freezing cold stream of cold air came in which made for a bit of an unpleasant dining experience.
Great cocktails and customer service. Looking forward to checking it out for dinner and the raw bar. Nice addition to the restaurant group.
The drinks were delicious. The food taste and presentation was beautiful. My waitress was very nice and helpful!
All around outstanding experience - food, cocktails, and excellent wine list. Must try the onion tarts.

Such an incredible place. There are multiple floors, each with a distinct vibe. Enjoy dinner in the sunlit main restaurant, head up to the roof for an evening drink, or wander down to the cellar for a prohibition-era cocktail. Something for everyone.
Nice cocktails but keeping in mind owners was expecting a longer list. Friendly service but took unexpectedly too long between first apps and the next courses and not even that busy at the time.

The doors just opened but this place moves like a really well made machine. The drink menu is fresh and fun but ordering off menu is just as easy and rewarding. The food is mainly meant to be shared (and it should be) because it's all delicious and you're gonna want to try it all. It is a bit pricey but for a great night out it's really worth it.

Had a special dinner date here this weekend. Things we LOVED: the ambiance upstairs and downstairs; the interesting menu; the friendly and attentive wait staff. Things that could IMPROVE: the wine pours; the cocktail prices; the strange walk-in policy (get credit cards for reservations!)  Overall, this place feels more SoHo than AdMo, but I think it will attract people looking for an upscale experience, people visiting from out of town, and guests from The Line hotel a few blocks up. Don’t see this as the hop across the street from Duplex Diner (yet?)

Enjoyed happy hour with friends! The service was great and the place looks amazing. Can't wait to check out the rooftop when it's finally nice out. If you have been to Jack Rose, you'll understand when I say that the cocktails at The Imperial are really, really good. It's a little pricey but normal DC prices. It's a good spot for happy hour, a date, etc.

The service was impeccable (we sat at the bar) and the gentlemen working were wonderful - friendly and very helpful. The person who I assume to be the manager was also extremely accommodating and kind, she placed a drink order for us while we waited to be seated. The food was delicious, we had the uni, oysters rockefeller, gnocchi and agnolotti. Dishes are smaller, tapas-like portions but we were definitely satisfied! Very cool ambiance, with a raw bar on the lower level. If you plan to stop by Dram & Grain after dinner, be sure to make a reservation there as well. If not, their sister bar, Jack Rose, is on the same block and was a lot of fun!

the oyster Rockefeller were amazing cocktails were great too. The selection of oysters is well balanced between with briny and sweet. The must have to try is definitely the imperial tower with hot and cold seafood.  The staff is extremely attentive to your every need. I’m glad this place finally opened I now have a great place to get dinner and drinks with friends.
Amazing place!!!

Absolutely stunning with the same quality and expertise I’ve come to know and love from the Jack Rose team. Amazing and creative cocktails, delicious food, friendly staff, and a great overall ambiance. Can’t wait to come back and try more!

Well, this was disappointing. The drinks are pretty good, but expensive (even for DC). The bar area is understaffed - our waiter was nice, but literally forgot about us while we were there. We won't be returning.
First rate staff, first rate cocktails, and first rate food in a beautiful and relaxing setting. Bravo!
